title.narrative: WANEP, West Africa Network for Peace Building II
WANEP, West Africa Network for Peace Building II

description.narrative: WANEP is a regional peace and security organisation with over 450 member organisations spread throughout West Africa. WANEP engages major actors, particularly governments and intergovernmental bodies to establish a platform for dialogue, thereby complementing efforts at ensuring sustainable peace and development.

WANEP är en regional fred och säkerhetsorganisation med över 450 medlemsorganisationer spridda runt i Västafrika. WANEP engagerar viktiga aktörer, framför allt regeringar och regionala organisationer, fr.a. ECOWAS, för att etablera en plattform för dialog, erfarenhetsutbyte och lärande, för att åstadkomma varaktig fred och utveckling.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: WANEP has signed an MOU with the African Union Commission to provide support to the Commission’s Peace and Security Department in the implementation of the AU Peace and Security Architecture (APSA) including the gender mainstreaming of the architecture. Discussions are underway on the opening of WANEP Liaison office to the African Union in Addis Ababa. At international level, WANEP has a Special Consultative status with the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) and is the West Africa Regional Representative of the Global Partnership for the Prevention of Armed Conflict (GPPAC). WANEP provides professional courses in conflict prevention and peacebuilding informed by several years of practical experience to governments, businesses, and practitioners throughout the region and beyond. Underlying its work is a commitment to professionalism and a dedication to a world of mutual respect, tolerance and peace.
According to the annual report of WANEP, '2016 was a year of bold steps and giant strides'. It has been indicated that WANEP reviewed and in some cases deepened collaboration with key stakeholders and clients. The WANEP-ECOWAS partnership that is now a reference success story about how CSOs can partner the State and intergovernmental organisations continued to gain traction. This collaboration has contributed to decentralizing the Early Warning and Response Systems and ensuring that the ECOWAS Member States provide leadership in the chain. In 2016, WANEP played prominent roles and resourcing intergovernmental organisations including UNOWAS, African Union, ECOWAS as well as Election Management Bodies and other international organisations in the management of electoral processes in West Africa.
In its effort to contribute to curbing violent extremism and supporting ECOWAS Counter Terrorism Strategy, WANEP collaborated with ECOWAS to develop preventive strategies for countering violent extremism through peace education in schools in the Sahel region. Recognizing that a culture of non-violence and community resilience is imperative for sustainable peace in the region and in the long term prevention of violent extremism, WANEP is partnering with the ECOWAS Early Warning Directorate, the Directorate for Education and Culture and the States in the Sahel to implement this agenda.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
